danaus

Class Randomer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Random
      • danaus.Randomer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Randomer
extends java.util.Random
    An instance is a pseudorandom number generator with more to offer than the standard Random class. It's like Random, but Randomer.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Randomer()
      Constructor: an instance with a random seed.
      Randomer(long seed)
      Constructor: an instance with seed seed.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean nextBoolean(double p)
      Returns true with probability p in the range [0,1].
      boolean nextBoolean(int probability)
      Returns true with probability p out of 1000.
      double nextDouble(double low, double high)
      Return a random double in the range low..high.
      <T> T nextElement(java.util.List<T> b)
      Return a random element of list b.
      <T> T nextElement(T[] b)
      Returns a random element of array b.
      int nextInt(int low, int high)
      Return a random integer in the range low..high.
      <T> java.util.List<T> sample(java.util.List<T> b, int n)
      Return a random sample of n elements from b.

    • Method Detail

      • nextInt

        public int nextInt(int low,
          int high)
        Return a random integer in the range low..high.

      • nextDouble

        public double nextDouble(double low,
                double high)
        Return a random double in the range low..high.

      • nextBoolean

        public boolean nextBoolean(double p)
        Returns true with probability p in the range [0,1].
        If p is given out of range, it is rounded to the nearest boundary. For example a probability of -0.5 will returns false.

      • nextBoolean

        public boolean nextBoolean(int probability)
        Returns true with probability p out of 1000.
        See Also:
        nextBoolean(double)

      • nextElement

        public <T> T nextElement(T[] b)
        Returns a random element of array b. Return null if b.length = 0.

      • nextElement

        public <T> T nextElement(java.util.List<T> b)
        Return a random element of list b. Return null if b.size = 0;

      • sample

        public <T> java.util.List<T> sample(java.util.List<T> b,
                           int n)
        Return a random sample of n elements from b.
        Precondition: 0 <= n <= b.size()
